intro: Pharus glaber var. parvifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pharus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces umbel-like inflorescences with white to pale yellow flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
